questions.question: What is the purpose of flow cytometry?

answers.a: To analyze the physical and chemical properties of cells and particles in a fluid sample
answers.c: To visualize cells and tissues at the microscopic level
answers.d: To measure the mass of cells and particles in a sample

questions.question: What is the purpose of sheath fluid?

answers.b: To position the sample of cells into a single file for optical interrogation
answers.c: To increase the speed of the flow
answers.d: To increase volume of the cellular mixture

questions.question: Which of the following is not a component of a flow cytometer?
What is forward scatter in flow cytometry?

answers.a: The measurement of light scattered at an angle to the laser beam
answers.b: The measurement of light emitted by fluorescent molecules in the sample
answers.c: The measurement of light scattered in the same direction as the laser beam
answers.d: The measurement of light transmitted through the sample
